articles.title: 9th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
9th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held 
    Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The 9th Kimjongilia Festival will be held at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition on the bank of the River Taedong
in Pyongyang for 10 odd days from February 12, Juche 94 (2005) on the occasion of the birthday of leader Kim Jong Il, the auspicious February holiday.
 In this period Kimjongilia shows and visits to flower green houses will took place in all provinces.    
 It will bring together commissions and ministries of the Cabinet, national institutions and units of armed forces successfully cultivating Kimjongilia, the immortal flower.

KCTU Vows to Stand in Van of Struggle for Reunification
articles.content:
KCTU Vows to Stand in Van of Struggle for Reunification 
    Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Ri Hye Son, chairperson of the Unification Committee of the (south) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, reportedly
held a press conference on January 7 and declared that the KCTU would stand in the van of the struggle to make this year the year of independent reunification.
 The working class should stand in the van of the reunification movement, Ri said, noting that the unionists would wage a more dynamic struggle for independent reunification with a view to significantly decorating this year, the fifth anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration and the 60th anniversary of the liberation of the country.    
 The main task of the KCTU this year is to get the "National Security Law" scrapped, have the decision to dispatch troops to Iraq cancelled and force the U.S. troops out of south Korea, the chairperson said, adding that to this end the confederation would put up a vigorous struggle.

articles.title: New Posters Appear
articles.content:
New Posters Appear 
    Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) --New posters powerfully encouraging the efforts of the working people who are hastening the general onward march of this year in response to the joint New Year editorial have appeared in the DPRK.
 Typical among them are "Let the whole Party and army and all the people unite as one in mind and more strikingly demonstrate the might of Songun!" and "Let us glorify this year which marks the 60th anniversary of the Party's founding as the most proud year to the loud drum-beating of the general onward march of Songun revolution!" These posters show the firm faith and will of the army and people of the DPRK to greet the significant fetes this year as grand festivals of proud victors.    
 The posters "Let us concentrate all efforts on successful farming!", "Let us give full play to the vitality of large-scale land rezoning!" call on the agricultural workers to do farming well to reap a bumper harvest of all crops and fruits this year. 
 There are also posters depicting the indomitable fighting spirit and morale of the Korean people and calling for keeping alive the superiority of the nation, frustrating the imperialists' ideological and cultural infiltration and firmly defending the socialist motherland.
